FuncDef:
The dynamic-flow age interval-multiplier command sets a multiplier of the measurement period to determine the flow aging time.
The undo dynamic-flow age interval-multiplier command restores the default aging time.
By default, the aging time is 10 times as long as the measurement period but cannot be shorter than 10 minutes.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a multiplier of the measurement period to determine the flow aging time.
The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 100.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set a multiplier of the measurement period to determine the flow aging time, run the dynamic-flow age interval-multiplier command. This facilitates maintenance.
